required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intra Cranial EEG Activity During Dexmedetomidine Sedation
clinical_study.official_title: Intra Cranial EEG Activity During Dexmedetomidine Sedation.Comparing the Effects of Dexmedetomidine on the Cortical and the Sub Cortical(Hippocampus) Structures.

brief_summary.textblock: Various parts of the brain are sensitive to various anesthetics.We like to study the effect of dexmedetomidine on the different parts of the brain in patients who are coming for DBS electrode removal under sedation.

detailed_description.textblock: Cortical and sub cortical structures will have different sensitivities to various anesthetics.The objective of this study is to look at the changes in the intracranial electroencephalographic (EEG) characteristics during dexmedetomidine sedation and to determine the differences in the EEG characteristics between cortical and subcortical structures.

primary_outcome.description: iEEG data from each patient was analyzed using MATLAB (Natick, MA, USA). Data were presented as power spectral density, also referred to as the power spectrum or spectrum which quantifies the frequency distribution of energy or power within a signal. The spectrogram is a time-varying version of the spectrum. In these spectrograms, frequencies are arranged along the y-axis, and time along the x-axis, and power is indicated by color on a decibel (dB) scale. The power spectrum was computed for each channel using The Fast Fourier Transform (FFT). A window length of 20,000 data points was chosen in order to incorporate 4 cycles of a 1 Hz signal. The length of each window was therefore 4 seconds. A Hanning window was used to avoid edge effects of the windowing procedure. The length of the FFT was chosen to be 32768, which is the next power of 2 of the window length. The window overlap was set to zero.

study_pop.textblock: Adults between 18 to 80 years of age, who are scheduled for elective removal of intracranial (surface and depth) electrodes under conscious sedation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults between 18 to 80 years of age, who are scheduled for elective removal of intracranial (surface and depth) electrodes under conscious sedation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of informed consent
- Hypersensitivity to dexmedetomidine
- Language barrier
- Emergency surgery

overall_official.affiliation: Assistant professor,Toronto western hospital,university health network (UHN)

group.title: iEEG Activity
group.description: iEEG data acquires every minute from the start of dexmedetomidine infusion to 5 minutes after the bolus dose.

baseline.population: 5 patients who underwent elective removal of intracranial (neocortical and depth) electrodes under dexmedetomidine sedation were recruited for this prospective, non-randomized, observational study

group.title: Dexmedetomidine Infusion and iEEG Activity
group.description: 5 patients included in this study underwent bi-temporal implantation, and were shown to have unilateral hippocampal seizure onsets. iEEG data acquires every minute from the start of dexmedetomidine infusion to 5 minutes after the bolus dose.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: iEEG Recording
outcome.description: iEEG data from each patient was analyzed using MATLAB (Natick, MA, USA). Data were presented as power spectral density, also referred to as the power spectrum or spectrum which quantifies the frequency distribution of energy or power within a signal. The spectrogram is a time-varying version of the spectrum. In these spectrograms, frequencies are arranged along the y-axis, and time along the x-axis, and power is indicated by color on a decibel (dB) scale. The power spectrum was computed for each channel using The Fast Fourier Transform (FFT). A window length of 20,000 data points was chosen in order to incorporate 4 cycles of a 1 Hz signal. The length of each window was therefore 4 seconds. A Hanning window was used to avoid edge effects of the windowing procedure. The length of the FFT was chosen to be 32768, which is the next power of 2 of the window length. The window overlap was set to zero.

reported_events.time_frame: From the time of induction to the end of surgical procedure

group.title: iEEG Activity

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
